cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward toward Nova Scotia and the Canadian Maritimes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern Nova Scotia (near or just west of Halifax)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – southwestern Nova Scotia from Avonport to Hubbards; Prince Edward Island; Magdalen Islands; southwestern Newfoundland from Parson’s Pond to Indian Harbour
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – eastern Nova Scotia from Hubbards to Avonport.  Tropical-storm warnings from Woods Hole MA east-ward to Eastport ME and large portions of Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Extreme southeastern New England, the coast of Maine, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and southern Newfoundland
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed in wind-probability table for South Florida
weather_observation.first_hazard: None (storm has already departed the area)
weather_observation.wind: None – the cyclone’s wind field is hundreds of miles northeast of Port Everglades
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge threat confined to Mid-Atlantic and Canadian Maritimes coasts
weather_observation.rainfall: None – heavy rain shield is well north of Florida
